title: Message from the President Regarding the Continuation of Emergency Regarding Export Control Regulations | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
August 12, 2011

 



Message from the President Regarding the Continuation of Emergency Regarding Export Control Regulations




TO THE CONGRESS OF THE UNITED STATES:
Section 202(d) of the National Emergencies Act (50 U.S.C. 1622(d)) provides for the automatic termination of a national emergency unless, prior to the anniversary date of its declaration, the President publishes in the Federal Register and transmits to the Congress a notice stating that the emergency is to continue in effect beyond the anniversary date. In accordance with this provision, I have sent to the Federal Register for publication the enclosed notice, stating that the emergency caused by the lapse of the Export Administration Act of 1979, as amended, is to continue in effect for 1 year beyond
August 17, 2011.

	BARACK OBAMA

	THE WHITE HOUSE,
	August 12, 2011.
